intro: Obione lurida, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are often covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Obione lurida is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
